&nbsp;&nbsp;</p><p align="center"><img src="/resources/Pictures/DC%20seal.PNG" alt="" title="" border="0" width="145" height="146" style="text-align: -webkit-center;"></p>  <p>Some highlights include:&nbsp;</p><ul><li>4 co-sponsored programs, including "LGBT Equality," "Addiction," "Police-Community Relations," and "Sexual Violence on Campus"</li><li>8 collaborative programs sponsored by AP-LS, including "Neuroimaging," "Sexual Violence on Campus," "Early Career Compass," and "Bullying"</li><li>More than 40 co-listed programs supported by AP-LS, including "The Wage Gap," "Parental Incarceration," and "#Blacklivesmatter"</li><li>Nearly a dozen co-listed programs for students, including "Intro to R," "Internship," and "Post-Doc Talk"</li><li>CE Sessions on Ethics in Correctional Settings, Ethics in Forensic Psych, Corrections Reform, and Women's Justice</li><li>Student section symposium - Social Science and Public Policy, Law</li><li>Book signing - Datchi &amp; Natalie Anumba have been named as the APA 2018 Convention Co-Chairs for Division 41 programming.&nbsp; Twila and Evelyn bring experimental expertise, while Natalie has expertise in clinical forensic psychology. &nbsp;<br></p><p>Given the 2-year terms that are traditionally served, Evelyn and Natalie will also be Co-Chairs for APA 2019 (Chicago), and a future President will decide whether to keep it at two Co-Chairs for that Convention or appoint a third Co-Chair.</p><div><img src="/resources/Pictures/grey%20line.png" alt="" title="" border="0" data-wawidth="1" width="185" style="width: auto;"></div><h2 data-waedittimecounter="126540" align="center"><font face="Verdana" style="font-size: 23px;">INTERNA-TIONAL MEGAN'S LAW</font></h2><p align="center"><font face="Verdana"><strong><font style="font-size: 14px;">Common Ground Series Article&nbsp;</font></strong></font></p><p align="center"><img src="/resources/Pictures/Common%20Ground.PNG" border="0" alt="" title="" data-wawidth="1" width="185" style="width: auto;"><br></p><p>Common Ground, sponsored by the AP-LS Student Committee, is a new Newsletter / &nbsp;E-News series designed to foster collaboration among lawyers, psychologists, and students in AP-LS. It seeks to highlight the unique contributions each group can make to the field of law-psychology. Each article will be co-authored by a student, a psychologist, and a legal professional in order to explore relevant issues from each perspective.&nbsp;<br></p><p>In this first article, Jennifer Kamorowski, J.D., Heather Ellis Cucolo, J.D., &amp; Allison D. Redlich, Ph.D. describe a new law, called "International Megan's Law," requiring registered sex offenders to bear a "unique identifier" on their U.S. passports. The article poses 3 arguments for why the passport identifer is not justified. Read the article on pages 7-12 of the latest PDF Newsletter <a href="/resources/Documents/APLS_Winter_2017.pdf" target="_blank">here</a>.&nbsp;</p></div></td>													</tr>												</tbody></table>											</td>										</tr>									</tbody></table>								</td><td align="" width="200" valign="top" class="cellContainer cell4Container">									<table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" width="100%">										<tbody><tr>											<td valign="top" data-cellouter="cell4" class="cellOuter" style="padding: 0px;">												<table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" width="100%" data-cellborder="1">													<tbody><tr>														<td valign="top" data-cellinner="cell4" class="cellInner" style="padding: 14px 8px 0px; background-image: none; background-repeat: repeat; background-position: 0% 0%;"><div data-innereditablearea="cell4" id="idEditableArea_1480696629541_cell4"><h2></h2><h2 data-waedittimecounter="126540" align="center"><font face="Verdana" style="font-size: 23px;">PRESIDENT'S ADDRESS</font></h2><p align="center"><font style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255);"><font color="#222222" style="background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); font-size: 15px;" face="Verdana"><img src="/resources/Pictures/Dave%20DeMatteo.jpg" alt="" title="" border="0" data-wawidth="1" width="100" style="width: auto;"><br></font></font></p><font style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255);"><font color="#222222" style="background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); font-size: 15px;" face="Verdana">Dave DeMatteo delivered his Presidential Address at this year's AP-LS annual conference in March. &nbsp;His title was "AP-LS and the Field of Psychology-Law: A Blueprint for the Future."
